Job Title: Identity Platform Engineer

Location: Grand Rapids, MI

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
As a family company, we serve people and communities. When you work at Meijer, you’re provided with career and community opportunities centered around leadership, personal growth and development. Consider joining our family – take care of your career and your community!

Meijer Rewards

Weekly pay Scheduling flexibilityPaid parental leave Paid education assistanceCare.com/back-up care assistance Team member discount Development programs for advancement and career growth

Please review the job profile below and apply today!

Please review the job profile below and apply today!

The Active Directory Technical Engineer will be responsible for overseeing our AD infrastructure, ensuring its optimal performance, security, and integration with other enterprise systems.

This position works either a Flexible Remote or a Hybrid schedule. For the Flexible Remote option, the Team Member must be able to travel to the corporate office on an as need basis. For the Hybrid schedule, the Team Member must live within reasonable commutable distance to our corporate offices in (Grand Rapids) Walker, MI to be able to work in office M-W, and optional work-remote Th-F. Relocation assistance available to align with Hybrid schedule requirements.

Responsibilities

Give input to and help manage the product roadmaps for on-prem Microsoft Active Directory, Certificate Authority, and Hardware Security Module ensuring their alignment with organizational needs and objectives.Lead the design, implementation, and maintenance of multi forest on-prem AD environment, CA, and HSM.Manage Domain controllers, CA and HSM for multi-cloud environment (Azure/GCP) Monitor and identify and potential issues, provide visibility, and resolve any related issues related to these products, ensuring minimal downtime.Responsible for resolving sync conflicts, upkeep of the environments, and ensure compliant with industry best practices.Coordinate with vendors and third-party support providers as needed.Stay current with the developments in IT Security, Identity, and related technologies.Prepare and maintain documentation related to products, configurations, processes, and procedures.

Qualifications

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, IT, or related field or equivalent experience.Minimum of 5 years’ experience with Domain controllers, Microsoft Active Directory, and related product management.Strong knowledge of Certificate Authority, DigiCert, Secret Management, and HSMGood understanding of privilege account management and AD TieringProficient in creating GPOs and understand their impacts.Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.Strong sense of accountability to ensure systems are kept up to date.

Desirable

Familiarity with other technologies like Azure Entra, AD Connect, IAM, SSO, MFA Certifications in Microsoft technologies. Experience in hybrid environments, integrating Exchange On-premise with Exchange Online. Knowledge of complementary systems like Microsoft Teams, SharePoint, etc.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
